reviews.review_msg: A fun class. Dr. Elliott is knowledgeable in what she teaches. The best part of this course are the tutorials: You get to do fun activities. Journals take effort but they are worth it. To do well you have to really read all the materials and view the DVDs. Guest speakers are inspirational and takes the class to a higher level. Great class and prof!

AWESOME!  This class is amazing.  Extremely recommended.  It gives a new perspective on CJS in a way you can actually learn and reflect on.  It is not a class where you have to read and memorize but learning through interaction.  And if your shy, dont be!  Melissa (TA) is extremely approachable and creates a welcoming environment :)

Liz is the best prof I've had!No notes, just attend class. She's really interesting and doesn't lecture for 3 hours like most profs do. Participation is key, but just being in class helps boost your mark a lot

Best prof I ever had, class is pretty easy, you just need to show up and write journals. There is not text book, you get to watch DVD's. Liz is really helpful, she has some good stories and keep the topics covered interesting. Good times :)
As always, Liz is very knowledgeable about her subject and wants her students to succeed. Alot of RJ leaked into this course (although that isn't necessarily a bad thing).
Avoid this class if you are not good in writting papers.

Don't take it by dist ed.  If you don't know how to write journals, you will have a problem.  There are no guidelines to begin with and the TA doesn't help much in that area.  They expect you to read 3 x 20pg articles and 3 ch. per week and integrate them into 3 pages while incorporating personal experience...most useless class I ever took.

I took this class by distance ed so I didn't get to meet the prof..but overall it was quite easy. The journal expectations were not clearly illustrated but it was ok. It was a bit time consuming thinking about your own, personal experience with restorative justice.
I took distance ed. so i dont know about the prof, but this course is by far the easiest upper crim course i took.
Liz is great by far the best prof in the faculty, if I was 20 years older I would definitely give her husband a run for the money
easy class. excellent TA's. lectures were somewhat boring, but guest speakers were interesting. if you're in favor of capital punishment, etc, this class will piss u off.
Her Corrections class is a joy to attend.
hot smart and funny
hot hot hot hot hot
This class was allright. Have to do a lot of work eventually, however it was fun and interesting.

Wow, I really can't believe that students would give Liz a bad rating.  I have learned alot from the classes and I think that she is very open to other ideas (even if they are opposite to her own).  In my opinion, she is very knowledgable and the work she does (outside of Uni!) is to be commended.

Course was extremely easy. I didn't enjoy writing the weekly journals though because I was running out of things to say the last couple of weeks. Course material is as left wing as you can get. If you don't lean left prepare to be frustrated at the readings.

Liz is is a naive fool.  Restorative justice is BS, and she's been sucked in by it.  People like her result in our revolving crimincal justice system.  She's close minded to anything else, and very arrogant in her views.
great lady, take any class you can with her
Good class, very little workload.  Tutorials are easy, and the final quiz was unbelievably easy!!  The class is quite left-leaning, but cynicism and doubts are accepted.

she knows the material & is prepared but a lot of the info was repetitive after some weeks. weekly journals weren't difficult to do but the TAs marked hard. go to the tutorials cuz you get to do fun activities!
no exams, no paper, 1 journal each week. what more could you ask for. EASY EASY EASY. No need for lectures or reading. material is fun to learn though, so go to the tutorials.

Liz's class is excellent, and it really opens your eyes to what is actually going on in the criminal justice system. The lectures were very interesting, and it is an awesome class to take. I highly reccommend it.

Well, not much I can say about Liz. She showed up prepared, but the material was very repetitive.  If you like easy marks then take this class, but if you are in school to learn something take another.  You learn very little in this class, and anything you do learn is repeated the entire semester.

Liz is one of the few profs who tries to be the change she envisions.  As for the comment about Liz hiding in the uni, maybe you should check out her track record for work in the prison and you'd discover otherwise.
Tries to impose her views on her students and leaves little room for personal decisions and opinions . over all not bad
No Comments
The easiest class ever in the school of Criminology, Enough said!
Liz!  You are the bomb!  You truly helped to reformulate my notions of restorative justice and my stance on punishment of offenders.  Thank you!

Liz is a super professor who genuinely enjoys explaining Restorative Justice and the concepts that go along with it. Plus, No midterm, no paper (except for journals), no final = 1 Helluva sweet course!
Liz is wonderful!  She makes sense and teaches you to really 'think out side of the box.'  She's the best prof up at SFU
No Comments
she's so cool ... reminds me of my buddy's mom
Helpful, interesting and inspiring
Interesting views, very helpful, understanding.
very interesting, very funny and helpful, give you chance as long as you ask
she is really nice and makes sense
